   20: 
   21: -module(list_bif_SUITE).
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   25:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   26: -export([hd_test/1,tl_test/1,t_length/1,t_list_to_pid/1,
   27:          t_list_to_ref/1, t_list_to_ext_pidportref/1,
   28:          t_list_to_port/1,t_list_to_float/1,t_list_to_integer/1]).
   29: 
   30: 
   31: suite() ->
   32:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   33:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   34: 
   35: 
   36: all() -> 
   37:     [hd_test, tl_test, t_length, t_list_to_pid, t_list_to_port,
   38:      t_list_to_ref, t_list_to_ext_pidportref,
   39:      t_list_to_float, t_list_to_integer].
   40: 
   41: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   42:     Config.
   43: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   44:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   45: 
   46: %% Tests list_to_integer and string:to_integer
   47: t_list_to_integer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   48:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_integer("12373281903728109372810937209817320981321ABC")),
   49:     12373281903728109372810937209817320981321 = (catch list_to_integer("12373281903728109372810937209817320981321")),
   50:     12373 = (catch list_to_integer("12373")),
   51:     -12373 =  (catch list_to_integer("-12373")),
   52:     12373 = (catch list_to_integer("+12373")),
   53:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_integer(abc)),
   54:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_integer("")),
   55:     {12373281903728109372810937209817320981321,"ABC"} = string:to_integer("12373281903728109372810937209817320981321ABC"),
   56:     {-12373281903728109372810937209817320981321,"ABC"} = string:to_integer("-12373281903728109372810937209817320981321ABC"),
   57:     {12,[345]} = string:to_integer([$1,$2,345]),
   58:     {error,badarg} = string:to_integer([$1,$2,a]),
   59:     {error,no_integer} = string:to_integer([$A]),
   60:     {error,badarg} = string:to_integer($A),
   61: 
   62:     %% System limit.
   63:     Digits = lists:duplicate(11_000_000, $9),
   64:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = catch list_to_integer(Digits),
   65:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = catch list_to_integer(Digits, 16),
   66:     {error,system_limit} = string:to_integer(Digits),
   67: 
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: %% Test hd/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
   71: hd_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72:     $h = hd(id("hejsan")),
   73:     case catch hd(id($h)) of
   74:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> ok;
   75:         Res ->
   76:             ct:fail("hd/1 with incorrect args succeeded.~nResult: ~p", [Res])
   77:     end,
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: 
   81: %% Test tl/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
   82: tl_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   83:     "ejsan" = tl(id("hejsan")),
   84:     case catch tl(id(104)) of
   85:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
   86:             ok;
   87:         Res ->
   88:             ct:fail("tl/1 with incorrect args succeeded.~nResult: ~p", [Res])
   89:     end,
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: 
   93: %% Test length/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
   94: 
   95: t_length(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   96:     0 = length(""),
   97:     0 = length([]),
   98:     1 = length([1]),
   99:     2 = length([1,a]),
  100:     2 = length("ab"),
  101:     3 = length("abc"),
  102:     4 = length(id([x|"abc"])),
  103:     6 = length("hejsan"),
  104:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch length(id([a,b|c]))),
  105:     case catch length({tuple}) of
  106:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  107:             ok;
  108:         Res ->
  109:             ct:fail("length/1 with incorrect args succeeded.~nResult: ~p", [Res])
  110:     end,
  111:     ok.
  112: 	      
  113: 
  114: %% Test list_to_pid/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
  115: 
  116: t_list_to_pid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  117:     Me = self(),
  118:     MyListedPid = pid_to_list(Me),
  119:     Me = list_to_pid(MyListedPid),
  120:     case catch list_to_pid(id("Incorrect list")) of
  121:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  122:             ok;
  123:         Res ->
  124:             ct:fail("list_to_pid/1 with incorrect arg succeeded.~n"
  125:                     "Result: ~p", [Res])
  126:     end,
  127:     ok.
  128: 
  129: %% Test list_to_port/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
  130: 
  131: t_list_to_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  132:     Me = hd(erlang:ports()),
  133:     MyListedPid = port_to_list(Me),
  134:     Me = list_to_port(MyListedPid),
  135:     case catch list_to_port(id("Incorrect list")) of
  136:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  137:             ok;
  138:         Res ->
  139:             ct:fail("list_to_port/1 with incorrect arg succeeded.~n"
  140:                     "Result: ~p", [Res])
  141:     end,
  142:     ok.
  143: 
  144: t_list_to_ref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  145:     Ref = make_ref(),
  146:     RefStr = ref_to_list(Ref),
  147:     Ref = list_to_ref(RefStr),
  148:     case catch list_to_ref(id("Incorrect list")) of
  149:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  150:             ok;
  151:         Res ->
  152:             ct:fail("list_to_ref/1 with incorrect arg succeeded.~n"
  153:                     "Result: ~p", [Res])
  154:     end,
  155:     ok.
  156: 
  157: %% Test list_to_pid/port/ref for external pids/ports/refs.
  158: t_list_to_ext_pidportref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  159:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  160:     Pid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, self, []),
  161:     Port = hd(rpc:call(Node, erlang, ports, [])),
  162:     Ref = rpc:call(Node, erlang, make_ref, []),
  163: 
  164:     PidStr  = pid_to_list(Pid),
  165:     PortStr = port_to_list(Port),
  166:     RefStr  = ref_to_list(Ref),
  167: 
  168:     Pid2  = list_to_pid(PidStr),
  169:     Port2 = list_to_port(PortStr),
  170:     Ref2  = list_to_ref(RefStr),
  171: 
  172:     %% Local roundtrips of externals work from OTP-23
  173:     %% as even though 'creation' is missing in the string formats
  174:     %% we know the 'creation' of the connected node and list_to_* use that.
  175:     true = (Pid =:= Pid2),
  176:     true = (Port =:= Port2),
  177:     true = (Ref =:= Ref2),
  178:     true = (Pid == Pid2),
  179:     true = (Port == Port2),
  180:     true = (Ref == Ref2),
  181: 
  182:     %% And it works when sent back to the same node instance,
  183:     %% which was connected when list_to_* were called.
  184:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '=:=', [Pid, Pid2]),
  185:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '==',  [Pid, Pid2]),
  186:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '=:=', [Port, Port2]),
  187:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '==',  [Port, Port2]),
  188:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '=:=', [Ref, Ref2]),
  189:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '==',  [Ref, Ref2]),
  190: 
  191: 
  192:     peer:stop(Peer),
  193:     ok.
  194: 
  195: -define(NEW_PID_EXT, 88).
  196: -define(NEW_PORT_EXT, 89).
  197: -define(NEWER_REFERENCE_EXT, 90).
  198: 
  199: %% Copy pid/port/ref but set creation=0
  200: make_0_creation(X) when is_pid(X); is_port(X); is_reference(X) ->
  201:     B = term_to_binary(X),
  202:     Sz = byte_size(B),
  203:     B2 = case B of
  204:              <<131, ?NEW_PID_EXT, _/binary>> ->
  205:                  PreSz = Sz - 4,
  206:                  <<_:PreSz/binary, Cr:32>> = B,
  207:                  true = (Cr =/= 0),
  208:                  <<B:PreSz/binary, 0:32>>;
  209:              <<131, ?NEW_PORT_EXT, _/binary>> ->
  210:                  PreSz = Sz - 4,
  211:                  <<_:PreSz/binary, Cr:32>> = B,
  212:                  true = (Cr =/= 0),
  213:                  <<B:PreSz/binary, 0:32>>;
  214:              <<131, ?NEWER_REFERENCE_EXT, Len:16, _/binary>> ->
  215:                  PostSz = Len*4,
  216:                  PreSz = Sz - (4 + PostSz),
  217:                  <<_:PreSz/binary, Cr:32, PostFix:PostSz/binary>> = B,
  218:                  true = (Cr =/= 0),
  219:                  <<B:PreSz/binary, 0:32, PostFix/binary>>
  220:          end,
  221:     binary_to_term(B2).
  222: 
  223: 
  224: %% Test list_to_float/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
  225: 
  226: t_list_to_float(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  227:     5.89000 = list_to_float(id("5.89")),
  228:     5.89898 = list_to_float(id("5.89898")),
  229:     case catch list_to_float(id("58")) of
  230:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> ok;
  231:         Res ->
  232:             ct:fail("list_to_float with incorrect arg succeeded.~nResult: ~p", [Res])
  233:     end,
  234:     ok.
  235: 
  236: id(I) -> I.
